title.narrative: F.a: Cherish Life, Treasure the Health - Health Education and Development for Women and Children in Rural Villages of Kashgar Prefecture

description.narrative: Health lessons are part of teaching curriculum, but there are no substantively and culturally appropriate materials and methods to teach effectively. Students begin to have decayed teeth already at 5 years of age, due to lack of knowledge and brushing habi ts. The diarrheal sicknesses are also very common among students. The teachers face challenge how to get the health messages through, how to encourage good habits for better health as the children grow. One teacher from each village Kindergarten and Primar y School is taught to use child friendly teaching methods in health education classes. The topics include participatory teaching methods, oral care, harms of smoking and good hygiene. Each teacher receives lesson plan books and a set of teaching materials. After teaching health lessons, teachers give each student dental care set. The older students receive smoking experiment kit / awareness rising kit to take home as well. The project goal is increased quality of life among rural communities of Kashgar thro ugh improved disease prevention knowledge and practises. The project purpose is improved health in rural communities through health education among school students, community members and Mother-Child Care Department. 450 – 500 teachers have been trained who continuously teach health lessons to 200 000 – 250 000 students. These students share the information with their families, reaching up to 750 000 community members' increased health awareness. The project beneficiaries include School teachers, villag e Kindergarten and Primary School students and their families. Fida partners with Kashgar Prefectural Health Bureau (KHB), the Government Department in Health System, in the project.
